meanings.definition: To surpass in reckoning or calculation.
meanings.sent1: She outreckoned her friend in solving the math problem.
meanings.sent2: The student outreckoned all others in the class with her quick calculations.
meanings.sent3: The calculator was surprised when it was outreckoned by the young girl's mental math skills.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outreckon numbers was like a superpower in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The way she outreckoned the others made her the math champion of the school.

meanings.definition: To be superior in estimation or judgment.
meanings.sent1: His keen eye for detail allowed him to outreckon his colleagues in the art gallery.
meanings.sent2: The experienced judge outreckoned the newcomers in determining the winner.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to outreckon the dog in choosing the comfiest spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition outreckoned any logical reasoning in making the right decision.
meanings.sent5: The way she outreckoned the situation showed her exceptional judgment skills.
